intro: Hieracium sylvaticum subsp. juelii, commonly known as the Juel’s wood hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and basal rosette of leaves. The plant produces yellow composite flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological and genetic traits compared to other Hieracium species.
